results.title: The Bribe
results.creator_credit: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.

results.title: The Bremen town musicians
results.brief_description: A puppet animation story of a cat, a dog, a rooster and a donkey. When they are told they are too old to work, they decide to run away to become musicians. At night they come upon a robbers hideout where they scare the robbers away and decide to live in the cottage. The robbers return, but the animals scare them away and live happily ever after. This film is recommended to children between the ages of 7-11.

results.title: The Breath of life
results.creator_credit: Bewick Hack, Visatone (Australia) and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of mouth to mouth or mouth to nose resuscitation in cases of apparent drowning, suffocation and electric shock. Shows how these conditions may occur, and demonstrates resuscitation technique.

results.title: The Breakfast club
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Ned Tanen and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: John Hughes wrote and directed this film which was to become the quintessential high school drama of the 80s. Claire, the princess; Andrew, the jock; John, the criminal; Brian, the nerdy brain; and Alison, the basket case are all faced with spending nine hours together in Saturday detention. They begin the day as strangers having nothing in common, but as the day progresses, they slowly develop a bond in recognising that they are not as different as their places in the high school caste system would have them believe. Cast includes: Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson, Molly Ringwald, Anthony Michael Hall, Ally Sheedy and Paul Gleason.

results.title: The Break with tradition
results.creator_credit: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities
results.brief_description: This program introduces viewers to the origins of modern art - a change from art representing reality to art for art’s sake. It explains one of the most revolutionary aspects of impressionist painting - the use of colour - as seen in the works of Monet, Pissarro and Renoir.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities

results.title: The Brave little toaster
results.brief_description: Let the brave little Toaster carry you away on an electrifying ride you will never forget. There’s laughs, there’s songs, there’s suspense and plenty of adventure as the little Toaster and his friends, the Vacuum Cleaner, the Clock Radio, the Electric Blanket and the Desk Lamp set off to find their young master after he mysteriously disappears. Breathtaking animation ensures this acclaimed tale of loyalty and courage is sure to brighten spirits and entertain for a long time to come. Based on the novel by Thomas M. Disch.

results.title: The Brass choir: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: A fine and artfully “composed” documentary film of the orchestra in performance. Shows a sensitive demonstration of the tone color of instruments from the orchestra’s brass section with excerpts from Beethoven’s 5th Symphony, the Nocturne from Mendelson’s Midsummer Night’s Dream, Wagner’s Tannhauser.

results.title: The Brain that wouldn't die
results.creator_credit: Joseph Green, Rex Carlton, Mort Landberg and Rex Carlton Productions
results.brief_description: After a car crash, a man keeps his wife’s head alive in his laboratory. As if this weren’t enough, an evil beast pounds and screams from a locked room adjacent to the lab, for some reason the film ends with the title “The Head that Wouldn’t Die” instead of “The Brain that Wouldn’t Die.” Cast includes Jason Evers (Dr. Bill Cortner, as Herb Evers), Virginia Leith (Jan Compton), Leslie Daniels (Kurt), Adele Lamont (Doris Powell), Bonnie Sharie (Blonde Stripper), Paula Maurice (Brunette Stripper), Marilyn Hanold (Peggy Howard) and Bruce Brighton (Dr. Cortner).
